results.title: Gift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Gift was shot in the Wolfen-Bitterfeld region of Germany, formerly part of the GDR. Home to intensive chemical production powered by local open-cut coalmines, Bitterfeld has been referred to as the filthiest city in Europe. Since the reunification of Germany, attempts have been made to redress the environmental damage, but the long-term effects remain evident in both the scarred landscape, and the poor health statistics of the people who live there. Gift is a mesmeric, impressionistic collage of images of industry, mining, pollution and community.

Gift is the German word for poison

results.title: The Will is not enough
results.creator_credit: Peter Jarvis, Howard Smith and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Middle East”.
The growth of Arab nationalism provided a base for President Nasser in his attempt to achieve Arab unity. Having dealt with the uniting of a vast number of peoples through Islam, the film considers the decline of the Ottoman Empire, the Imperial conquests of the European powers and the first Nationalist Movements that appeared within the Arab world. Newsreel footage from the 1920’s, 1930’s and 1950’s is used.

results.title: Technics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”
Describes and demonstrates the development of new methods for study of the microbial masses adhering to the teeth and soft tissues in the mouth.

results.title: Inhabitants: their activities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”.
A documentation of the discovery of an details of microcosms living in the “scum” covering our teeth. Many microscopic pictures of microcosms and lots of scientific terms used.

results.title: Role in periodontal disease
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”.
An inside view of microbial community and their inhabitants and the role in inception and progression of periodontal disease. Know the cause and take preventative measures.
